alert.note: Alert for Manatee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 10 at 1:26PM EDT until September 10 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Florida and west central Florida, including the following counties, in southwest Florida, Charlotte. In west central Florida, Manatee and Sarasota. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 126 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Sarasota PD has reported flooding in the St Armands Circle area where roads have been closed. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - St Armands Circle is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Port, Sarasota, Bradenton, Punta Gorda, Port Charlotte, Gulf Gate Estates, South Gate Ridge, Ridge Wood Heights, South Sarasota, Southgate, Saint Armands Key, North Sarasota, Sarasota Bradenton Airport, South Bradenton, Bradenton Beach, Venice Gardens, South Venice, Nokomis, Warm Mineral Springs and Laurel. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
